Nakuru is the administrative and economical headquarters of Nakuru County. Convienently situated between Nairobi and Western Kenya, it also serves as a transit city for many travellers.
L.Nakuru airstrip is available for landing.
There is only one train line, the Nairobi-Kisumu train, however it is not operating currently (for some years now).

From Nairobi, the 158km (100 Miles)journey would take approximately 2hours. The newly renovated roads can be dangerous as only sections have dual carriageways. The scenery is beautiful, from Nairobi you will see the Great Rift Valley below from the highway.

Mololine, Crossroads and other matatu operators offer 9 seater and 14 seater matatu services from Nairobi. Mololine is known for its excellent service and security.

The large bus companies have Nairobi to Kampala coaches which stop in Nakuru. Busways have booking offices opposite the mosque.

Lake Nakuru National Park is home to the famous pink flamingoes. It also offers viewing of various other species of animals and birds.

Menengai Crater is a dormant volcanoes that still spews out smoke. A view from the edge of the crater is a must.

value: content=African food for around 100-150 shillings per course.
directions=Mburu Gichua road at the south end by the roundabout.
content=A mix of African and Western food. Pizza 300S, most courses a little less.
content=Western food in an upmarket hotel. Meals for around 500S, they also have a pool you can use for 300S

Local drinks (Tusker)from the local bars, pops are available.
There are a great many budget hotels available in Nakuru, many are within 5 minutes walking distance from the Matatu station.

value: address=opposite Kamba bus station, along Nakuru - Eldoret highway
content=Hostel with a bar and hot showers.
Currently Backpacker's is under renovation, so guests are being sent to a different guest house.  It's a christian place with decent food, but doesn't really have a backpacker's atmosphere.
directions=Right at the start of Kenyatta Ave when coming from the Matatu station.
content=The cheapest are very small rooms with bathroom, reasonably clean, with mosquito nets, and good security. Downstairs is a restaurant and a quiet bar.
address=General Kariba Street, near Moi Rd
directions=100 metres west of Afraha Stadium
content=Clean, secure, and comfortable hotel with pleasant staff. Wireless internet in lobby, good restaurant.

At the Westside Mall (intersection Kenyatta Ave and West Road) is a new Java Coffee (like Starbucks) with free Wifi and good coffee. There are also many "Cyber" (internet cafes) all over down town.

Nakuru is safe to walk around during daytime. In the evening, Bazaar Road and the small side lanes don't feel too safe anymore. After 23:00 the night security guards in front of the banks on main Kenyatta Road start to fall asleep and nobody seems to walk on the streets anymore.
